formattedAddress: 155 W 43rd St, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: 155 W 43rd St, New York, NY 10036, USA

editorialSummary.text: All-American comfort food for breakfast, lunch & dinner in a nostalgic diner-style space.

originalText.text: So I needed some breakfast and this was an restaurant that was recommended by a friend. It didn’t disappoint. The staff was nice and they accommodated me eating by myself and fit me in on a pretty long wait so if you were in the area definitely stop by. The food was excellent. The service was excellent and the location obviously was great. If they’re really busy, the modifications to the menu may not be available but that’s understood. I had their scrambled eggs, bacon, coffee and it was spectacular. I will definitely come back and wanna leave everything positive for this place.

originalText.text:
Brooklyn Diner: A Taste of New York Celebrity

Checked out Brooklyn Diner, a stone’s throw from Times Square and a hotspot frequented by the famous. Visiting around Thanksgiving, I braced for a long wait, but they were spot-on with their 20-minute estimate.

The server was pleasant and offered up some recommendations. My daughter tried the hot chocolate, which, to be honest, wasn’t quite what we expected. It was unusually thick – we even added milk to thin it out. Maybe it’s a New York thing, or perhaps just not to our taste.

Not usually a sandwich guy, but I dove into their pastrami sandwich on a recommendation. It’s a solid choice – good portion size and tasty enough to pass on the recommendation.

While the restaurant buzzes with activity, it’s the celebrity allure that adds spice to the visit. Imagine dining at Jerry Seinfeld’s table! Great for a selfie and a story to tell.

So, swing by for the experience, snap some photos, but don’t expect culinary fireworks. It’s more about the novelty than a gastronomic revelation.

While the restaurant buzzes with activity, it’s the celebrity allure that adds spice to the visit. Imagine dining at Jerry Seinfeld’s table! Great for a selfie and a story to tell.

originalText.text:
If you think you've tasted French toast, think again, because the Brooklyn Diner in NYC takes it to a whole new, almost illegal level of deliciousness with their Pecan and Raisin French Toast. This isn't just breakfast; it's a flavor fiesta in your mouth!

The toast itself? Imagine a pillow fight between crispy and fluffy, and the toast is winning. Each bite is like receiving a loving, nutty hug from a pecan and a sweet, chewy kiss from a raisin. It's like they threw a party on the plate, and cinnamon was the DJ.

Sitting in the diner, with its charmingly retro vibe, you'll half expect a waitress on roller skates to roll up and ask if you're enjoying the '80s sitcom of a meal you're having. The atmosphere is as inviting as a bear hug from your favorite uncle – you know, the one with all the dad jokes.

In conclusion, if you haven't tried the Pecan and Raisin French Toast at the Brooklyn Diner, are you even living? It's more than a meal; it's an edible stand-up comedy show where the punchline is always delicious. Don't walk, run to try it, but maybe not with scissors. Safety first, folks!

originalText.text: Excellent meal, wonderful atmosphere  and amazing service.  Waffle grilled cheese pastrami was different but very good,  was like a New York version of a Monte Cristo.  Both burgers where very good, order well done unless you like a little red.  Loved the fries and the meal... 5 Stars...

text.text: Excellent meal, wonderful atmosphere  and amazing service.  Waffle grilled cheese pastrami was different but very good,  was like a New York version of a Monte Cristo.  Both burgers where very good, order well done unless you like a little red.  Loved the fries and the meal... 5 Stars...

originalText.text: Fast paced diner with loads of good food! It’s close to Times Square and busy but you don’t wait long. Staff is so very nice and friendly and the food is made with care. I had the waffle grilled cheese: so delicious! My only complaint is that my marshmallow was so big in my hot chocolate that I had to take it out! Haha! Not a real complaint though, everything was good and well worth the visit here!
